{{also|Appendix:Variations of "ei"}} ==Translingual== {{wikipedia|Exponential integral}} ===Noun=== {{head|mul|symbol}} # The exponential integral, a [[special function]], defined as: #: Ei(x)=\int^x_{-\infty} \frac{e^t}{t} dt [[Category:mul:Mathematics]] ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|ei}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*ajją}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*h₂ōwyóm}}. Compare {{cog|nl|ei}}, obsolete {{cog|en|ey}}, {{cog|fy|aai}}, {{cog|da|æg}}, {{cog|yi|איי}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|de|De-Ei.ogg|audio}} * {{IPA|de|/aɪ̯/}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Eies|gen2=Eis|Eier|Eichen|dim2=Eierchen|dim3=Eilein}} # [[egg]] {{gloss|all biological senses}} #: {{ux|de|Willst du dein '''Ei''' hart oder weich?|Do you want your '''egg''' hard-boiled or soft-boiled?}} #: {{ux|de|Das befruchtete '''Ei''' nistet sich in der Gebärmutter ein.|The fertilised '''egg''' nidates in the uterus.}} # something egg-shaped # {{lb|de|informal|usually|in the plural}} [[testicle]]; [[ball]] {{qualifier|also figuratively}} #: {{ux|de|Mal sehen, ob ihr '''Eier''' habt!|Let’s see if you guys have '''balls'''!}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|in the plural}} [[buck]]s {{gloss|money}} #: {{ux|de|Kost’ dreißig '''Eier''', der Spaß.|This thing costs thirty '''bucks'''.}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|usually vocative|mildly|_|pejorative}} [[clown]]; [[foolish]] [[bloke]] #: {{ux|de|Da steht „ziehen“, du '''Ei'''.|[The sign] says “pull”, you '''clown'''.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-n|(e)s|er}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |eiförmig |Eieruhr |Eigelb|Eiklar|Eiweiß |'n Appel und 'n Ei |[[Osterei]], [[Oster-Ei]] |[[Tee-Ei]], [[Teeei]] |Weichei }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Eggs]] ---- ==Plautdietsch== ===Noun=== {{head|pdt|noun|g=n|plural|Eia}} # [[egg]] ====Derived terms==== * {{l|pdt|Eiajälet}} * {{l|pdt|Eiaküak}} * {{l|pdt|Eirunt}} * {{l|pdt|Eiaschol}} * {{l|pdt|Eiastock}} * {{l|pdt|Eiawittet}} [[Category:Plautdietsch one-syllable nouns]]
